S1E1 Klaw
Long long battle against Klaw, but Rogue took him down. Part of the issue is still getting familiar with her kit and how to use her Touched upgrade properly.
She's similar to Valkyrie with her Death Glow upgrade, but way way more capable than Valkyrie. She's not shutdown completely if she can't move her Touched upgrade around, but is just lest "optimal" when that happens.
Something I learned, use Energy Transfer first to attach the upgrade, so that you still have an option to move it before you end your turn (like stick it on the villain so Bulletproof Belle works). Of course, if you use it to soften up a minion, you can then overkill the minion and still attach the upgrade.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game Rogue Hero Pack

Wow! Karma's a bleep.

When I had milano, Eye of Agamotto and Quincarrier out I figured I had enough resource out for the card draw. I used Chance encounter to get Nick at the end for the final push. 49 card deck plus the Heavy Cannon which was the offensive MVP of the game to keep whiltting Ronan down 2 damage at a time. Electro came out twice.

Oh yeah, this was the epic win against Expert Red Skull I was looking forward to see. Just as things were about to look grim with RS putting 10 threat (almost a loss) on the main scheme and pull out more side schemes. I pulled the epic finish. I had 10 cards in hand at the start of my turn. Avengers Mansion to go to 11 cards. Play two cards to put Maria Hill in play and draw two cards with her and Knowhere! Back to 11. I had 3 Sliding Shots in my hand! Red Skull had tough and 15 HP (and retaliate). Star Lord was at 4 HP. I had two Gutsy Moves in hand! Four allies down on the board!
Guess what I cleared the board of threat, played Iron Heart, and drew a third Gutsy Move and cycled my deck! I had hit him for 13 HP right before that, but then I was doing 17 HP of damage with a sliding shot to take him out and enough cards to play another 17 HP sliding shot!

Another loss to standard Collector Escape the Museum. I think I'm trying to hard to go fast. The three turn win must have been a fluke. I get into the last stage easily, but quite unprepared. You need to really go quick in the last stage.

Yes, this time Quicksilver does the standard Collector Escape the Museum this time. It took much longer and I was in stage 2 for a LONG time setting up. However, when I was ready, I hit the afterburners to remove 12 threat for the win and burned through stage 3 in one go. 4 threat was left on stage 2, and QS was bumped up to 3 THW per action and then I added Maximum Velocity to 5 THW per action. This is the way to win it if you want to be prepared to finish off the Collector and not waste time dealing with the Collector's ship hitting you every villain phase.

Alright, I survived better with Wasp this time against Standard Zola and killing him with overkill only. Good game. It took a while, but we got there. Had some very close calls especially due to scheming.

Testing standard campaign against Ronan. Big loss

Another tough loss to standard Ronan campaign and Ant-man justice.
More losses against Standard Ronan campaign and Ant-man Justice.
Surprise another loss with Ant-man justice standard Ronan campaign.

One rule tweak. Milano upgrades are permanent setup at the start of Standard Ronan campaign encounter. Finally, I got the win, but it was not easy at all. One of the toughest battles I faced, but this feels more balanced. It came down to the wire. Ronan at 1HP, and I had 2 HP. I had to survive one more encounter with him hitting for 5ATK plus overkill and the environment that does 1 damage at the end of the villain phase. I survived with no damage because of Armored plating and got the win. These feels like a more balanced rule tweak for solo campaign.

Groot/Protection taking on expert Klaw. Couldn't keep up with threat this round, and it went quick.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Galaxy's Most Wanted

Much better round with Groot Protection against expert Klaw. It took a long time to get him down. At one point, things were looking grim when there six minions on the board, and I was fighting to stay afloat. Three of those minions were armored guards and two where beefy masters of evil. It took a while to get them chipped away. I wouldn't be surprised if this match went 1.5 to 2 hours to finally beat him down. I didn't waste any resources getting rid of his attachmments.

Expert Green Goblin Mutagen Formula is manhandled by Leadership Captain Marvel. Using core set hero cards.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Green Goblin Scenario Pack
Rocket Raccoon hops in the Milano to stop expert Crossbones who recruited the Band of Badoon to take on the Pegasus Facility to get the reality stone. RR takes him down.

Epic! Epic game against Expert Kang and Rocket Aggression! Wow! Lots of lows to fight through for the eventual win! I did lose the 2nd stage not without trying. I fought hard, but I was struggling to stabilize just as I was making progress on stage 2. I found out it's not as painful ending stage 2 on the villain phase (scheme out), because I get my turn after that at the start of stage 3. It was still a tough battle to get stable when I had to flip to almost recover and then get threat back down. It's tough in aggression even with Rocket's high thwart capacity. I had a blast though getting that win finally.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Galaxy's Most Wanted -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Once and Future Kang Scenario Pack

Insane ride again with Rocket on expert Ultron. Cooking all the crazy sauce with Rocket Launcher, Hall of Heroes, Schadenfreude, and alter ego ability. Follow throughs were nice getting that extra punch with Relentless Assault or Particle Cannon.

Beat the snot out of standard Ultron and Aggression Rocket. Rocket just eats Ultron for breakfast. I'll have to try expert now.

Tentative Victory against Standard Ronan. I had to replay the first villain phase again because I misdealt encounter cards. I may dealt one less another time though so I can't call it a clean win plus I might have missed the Pincer maneuver side scheme.

Cleaner game against Standard Ronan. He schemed out, but I lasted much longer by getting the Universal Weapon and Kree Supremacy out of play turn one. Yes, I had to take four encounter cards still, but that universal weapon gone also makes a big difference. You can now confuse and stun Ronan if necessary plus less atk and sch.

Second go around with Standard Nebula went better. Ant-Man justice got her down before the player deck ran out and just as the encounter deck ran out. I read the rules better in that I was handling the attachments wrong and did do the evasion counter removal correctly the first time. It wasn't easy, and I tad lucky with Shadows of the Past going away on the opening draw and so few minions coming out.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game Ant-Man Hero Pack -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Galaxy's Most Wanted

Standard Ronan... Ant-Man Justice. Got beat down in turn 3, and I think I would have died in turn two because I forgot about all those stupid encounter cards. You start out with four encounter cards in the villain phase!!!! Stupid Pincer Manuever is a second side scheme added to the mix for campaign with a wonky threat addition if you did well with evasions counters in the previous scenario. Ugh.
Spent all my units for a 4 cost card by the way. I got the armor plating to help with the beat down. Never came out and none of the Milano upgrades came out.

Up against Standard Collector Escape the Museum. Note to self, don't take so many encounter cards with the Library action. It's tempting, but use it sparingly sheesh. Tough loss.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game Ant-Man Hero Pack -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Galaxy's Most Wanted

Did much better this time against Standard Collector Escape the Museum. I focused more on natural thwart abilities and didn't try to get the standard challenge side scheme until the end instead of at the beginning. I used Hyper Thrusters to good use and got the Milano out in turn one. That worked much better. Hyper Thrusters kept whittling down the side scheme threat while working the main scheme.
Down to 1 HP when I finished. 4 Units and spent all four to get the Heavy Cannon for Milano.

Standard Nebula is tough. I almost got the win had I not got schemed out on the last turn. I didn't handle any of the evasion counters because they're so expensive. I can't imagine winning the game with one or less evasion counters.

Aggression Ant-Man against Standard Drang in the campaign setting. Fun challenge. The Badoon minions definitely add some annoying twists. I did get the headhunter for 2 victory points. I think my total is 4. It took a little while, but I got the victory. Double Hand Cannons were nice when I got to use them, but too many times I had to defend so didn't use them as much. Follow Through unfortunately never got put down at all because of prioritizing over Ant-man upgrades, so I didn't get amazing overkills.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game Ant-Man Hero Pack -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Galaxy's Most Wanted

Justice Ant-man makes it in to the museum against Standard Collector - Infiltrate the Museum. Oh boy it was HARD! I can't image this on expert where he gets to start with two of your cards in the collection. Plus, how many cards you going to lose out of your expert deck for the rest of the campaign!!!
I tried hard to minimize the allies in play. Wiccan was a MVP putting out damage with thwart. Those Galactic Artifacts are just nasty. I wish that you could free up more cards from the collection beyond one per round.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game Ant-Man Hero Pack -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Galaxy's Most Wanted

First play with Rocket Raccoon against Standard Green Goblin Mutagen. Very enjoyable with his pre-con aggression deck. He's potent solo because he can thwart very well and do great damage. First play with Groot pre-con protection against Standard Green Goblin Mutagen. He's a lot harder to pilot then Rocket because he doesn't have consistent good thwart. 12 HP and 3 captives freed: Moon Knight, White Tiger, and Elektra. When I saw I missed my opportunity to get Shang Chi early in the second round of the encounter deck, I decided to finish off Taskmaster in good fashion. I didn't want to play another hour to cycle the encounter deck.

Played both heroes: Protection Quicksilver and Justice Scarlet Witch against expert Green Goblin Mutagen Formula. Man, long game, but I prevailed. Great win against standard Taskmaster in the Excelsior challenge (Alter Ego only). Black Widow I think did a better job than She-hulk. Of course the first five or six turns were tough getting established and keeping threat down. Once all beat cops were in play, then I rest way easier. Black Widow has the advantage over a lot of heroes in that she can confuse the villain and remove 4 threat (Covert Ops) in alter-ego mode. This is key to freeing captives too. Also, she has a lot of prep cards that even though that don't function in alter-ego mode, they thin your deck way down so you're cycling Cover Opts, allies, counterintelligence, spycraft, and espionages.
Played with the following expansions: -Marvel Champions: The Card Game Black Widow Hero Pack -Marvel Champions: The Card Game The Rise of Red Skull

First play of Scarlet Witch. I used her pre-con deck against Rhino. Wow! She's cray good. I'm not sure I really broke a sweat with her. She has some crazy good thwart and great allies. She doesn't have a lot of support, but what little she has is great. Spiritual Meditation is great for crafting your hand and combine that with Agatha Harkness!
Anyway.. easy win.

Played expert Red Skull without all the campaign fluff. Captain America Justice still handled him, but it did take longer without all the crazy card draw. Red didn't quite make it through the encounter deck before I finished him off.

Crushed the expert Red Skull in the final round with Captain America Leadership. Red almost defeated Captain America knocking him down to 1HP, but he was able to rally for a glorious finish. Tactical Scanner was the MVP card of the game. It was the first card I played at the start to help set my board up with quite a few cards. Then came back in the final round at the right time. My deck was almost empty after I fought my way back out of my 1HP hole. Red Skull was sitting at 16HP (second stage). I play Tactical Scanner to start my turn and draw 5 (at 10) cards because of Assess the Situation previous round). I defeat Censor the Past side scheme to shuffle Tactical Scanner back into the deck and then draw two cards from Skilled Investigator and Improved Thward Upgrade (12 cards). I play Fearless Determination to then draw Tactical Scanner again!! I draw 5 more cards and triggers a reshuffle (16 cards). I play Moon Knight and use Quincarrier to draw two more cards (17 cards) and draw Tactical Scanner AGAIN!!!!! I draw 5 more cards (21 cards!!). Let's just say Red Skull didn't survive that round.

Long game, but Expert Zola went down to the power of Captain America Leadership. 10 HP. I did free Agent 13. I had the big finish with "Strength in Numbers" (2 assess situations previous round), Steve's Apartment to to draw up to 13 cards in the round then finish off with Avenger's Assemble and shield toss (eliminate a guard). 21 total damage. Giant man with reinforced suit is wicked good because it keeps him punching at 4ATK.

Captain America Justice takes down Taskmaster. I only freed two captives though: Moon Knight and Shang Chi. It will have to do. I didn't feel like playing another hour just to free the other two who came up during boost draws.
13 HP. Tactical Scanner, 5 delay counters, Basic Thwart Upgrade
Tough scheme out loss to Absorbing Man expert with Captain America Aggression. I really didn't utilize my allies well and was not aggressive as I should have been.

Much better round against expert Absorbing Man. I took him down in 5 rounds with 11 HP (full health). I took the tactical scanner but didn't use it this round and may not ever use it. I may take the basic thwart upgrade this time for fun.

Captain America/Aggression throttles expert Crossbones in no time. I didn't even use Heroic Strike nor did I finish going through my deck once. Took all the experimental weapons though. I haven't decided item to select. 11 HP full health, so no obligation cards this round.
Captain Marvel/Justice destroys Red Skull (expert). 13HP left. Laser Cannon for the finish.

Captain Marvel/Leadership finishes off expert Zola quite handily. I spent a good chunk of the game just building board and putting allies in play. Focused more on keeping the minions down at first before laying into Zola. Ended with 13HP and improved attack upgrade.
Captain Marvel easily handled expert Taskmaster. Freed all captives in the first go of the encounter deck. 13HP.

Ant-man with pre-con Leadership plus 3 assess the situations basic cards took down the mighty expert Kang!! I had Masters of Time encounter set and took out Kang (Master of Time) twice.

First play of Ant Man against Expert Crossbones... wow. Ant man is potent even with precon deck. Took Crossbones down almost like he was nothing.

Thor Justice for the win against Red Skull! * on it.
Loss to Expert Red Skull Thor Justice. Once you get behind on side schemes, it's hard to get back up. I had a good board too, but just couldn't get back up.

My first loss to expert Taskmaster!! Always due to threat with a Justice Deck!! What???? Man, I'm off my game. I used to own Taskmaster completely every time. It wasn't horrible loss, but I'm wondering if being sick is really affecting me.

Solo Champions League Season 2 Round 3 Match 2 against Standard Ultron/Legions of Hydra with Captain Marvel Leadership. Cleaner game this round. I got Hawkeye in play turn 1 that helps immensely and got him back with Rapid Response for more drone control. Got the win in turn 7.

Unfortunately, I almost went to stage 3 of the scheme when I went alter ego to heal up. Survived. I was able to Make the Call to get Hawkeye finally into play. The biggest play was to flip Ultron to Stage II ad double tap with Goliath to do 10 damage! Finished Ultron in two more turns with a win in turn 7. It got a little hair there.
Solo Champions League Season 2 Round 3 - Captain Marvel against Standard Ultron w/ Legions of Hydra. Took him down in 9 turns. Leadership.

Match 3 of Solo Champions League Round 4. Black Panther Leadership against Ultron Bomb Scare Expert. Smoother round. I had Ultron to stage 3 by turn 5. Worked him down as fast as I could with lots of allies.

Solo Champions League Round 4 match 2. Black Panther / Leadership against Ultron Bomb Scare Expert. Turn 14 win. Tough battle. It took a while to get Black Panther's upgrade train going. I had reshuffled my deck to get 3 wakanda forevers in hand to get Ultron flipped and down to 17 even while clearing minions. Next 3 turns was almost all allies with all the defending BP had to do against upgraded drones (+3rd stage Ultron upgrade). Took two Make the Calls to Nick Fury to get Ultron down to 3. Last hand was to play Hawkeye to clear last drone than Make the Call to get Wonder Man to land the killing blow. BP was exhausted. Allies for the win! I was so hoping to draw one more Wakanda forever to finish up Ultron those last three turns, but couldn't do it. I had to let the main scheme go to stage 3 at turn 14 too, figure it was better than clearing more minions to finish off Ultron.

Solo Champions League Round 4 Match 1 - Black Panther Leadership against Ultron Expert with Bomb Scare. Turn 11.
Tough match, but I pulled it off. I think I like how my deck worked with the extra cards to mitigate the drone minion pull on my deck so I feel like I have options to replace cards that get converted. My deck was 46 cards. The extra six cards seemed like a good number with how many drones happen between going through my whole deck . I went through it twice. In stage two of villain, it is very easy to do two drones per villain phase without extra treachery cards.
Falcon came in handy getting the threat down. I used almost every ally at least once... except mockingbird surprisingly. I did consider using "blockingbird" though but went with something else at the time to get more thwart. I think it was Iron man who got some work done. It took forever to get Hawkeye out. I gave him up first hand to get and Avengers Mansion down and I"m ot sure if that was a good tradeoff. However, it helped getting him again eventually.
Black Panther Leadership against standard Ultron + Bomb Scare. Got the win in 10. Found the power of Avengers Assemble and team work.
Another scheme out with standard Klaw+Doomsday chair. Black Panther couldn't get it going.

Another win with Black Panther Aggression on standard Klaw with MODOK. Definitely need the allies to keep Black Panther in the game while laying out the board. BP seems slower than I would expect. Mean Swing is so nice since BP comes with two weapons that can be exhausted that don't stop their special ability.

Standard Klaw+MODOK. Almost had him with Hulk's prebuilt deck. I dealt Klaw 16 damage with two drop kicks and two basic attacks (boundless rage) to leave him with 2HP before scheme out. So tough without consistent thwart in solo.
Another loss to klaw + modok.
Made one single change to hulk. 5 card hand in hero form. HUGE DIFFERENCE. beat Klaw Modok bad.
Bad loss to Klaw + MODOK. Playing Black Panther. I was close, but I'm rusty with him.

WOW. Klaw + MODOK could have been more rough. MODOK came out in turn 4, I had to sit and think awhile. I decided to ignore him and go for finishing off Klaw and hope a guard didn't come out. I made it at turn 6.. phew. 3 Avengers Mansion probably helped.

Solo Champions Leage Round 2 match 1 - loss. Standard Ultron. I had everything go wrong in one turn - nemesis and obligation! I let Invasive AI stay on the board too long (extra encounter card). Got beat down at the end of turn 7.
Standard Ultron

Solo Champions League Round 2 Match 2 - Standard Ultron. much better, got the gamma slam down in turn 6 for the win. Kept the schemes under control. Utilize Maria Hill, Hawkeye, and Squirrel Girl very well. Standard Ultron
Solo Champions League Round 2 Match 3- Yeah, another win Turn 9. against Ultron Standard Under Attack. 2 out of 3 with She Hulk who I'm not good at against Ultron... I'm quite happy.
She Hulk leadership test run against standard Rhino with Bomb Scare. Good win in 8 turns.
Played basic deck. Scheme out loss Standard Rhino
Gots the win with start deck Standard Rhino
Standard Rhino with Bomb Scare Hulk Leadership works better
Got the win. Leadership smooths out Hulk's craziness with the help of allies. Standard Rhino
Standard Rhino
Super thrilling win for the first time. I was about to die with everything bad coming out on turn 3 of the villain phase. Too much threat, nemesis, down to four health.... Hulk smash! Standard Rhino
Tough loss. Standard Rhino
Super close loss. Standard Rhino
Another close one. Standard Rhino
Tried a new speed deck. Lost :( Standard Rhino Bomb Scare
Got the win with custom deck Standard Rhino
Another loss with custom deck. Not much different than stock Standard Rhino
Another loss with custom deck. Not much different than stock. Standard Rhino
Another tough loss with custom deck. Standard Rhino
Another tough loss with custom aggression. Standard Rhino
First game with Hulk against Standard Rhino. Tough loss when I could have him. Got board overwhelmed. Hulk is very thematic and tricky to play.
Tough loss to standard Green Goblin with Thor Justice
Even more brutal loss. Standard Green Goblin. Got ganged up bad against a lot of minions. Couldn't get a lightning strike to save my life.
2nd Thor Justice deck against standard Klaw. Got the win in 11 turns. Loki showed up, but I got rid of him. A lot of give and take with this and I only went alter ego once to heal up.

Standard Rhino. Tried Thor taking Avengers Mansion and QuinCarrier out and putting two haymakers in for damage and energy. Worked well. Slow game only because it took a while to get Asgard down... I think. Of course, having Under Surveillance down makes me slow down I think. I'm more okay with going alter-ego to heal when I have threat down. I did a turn with two hammer throws off and then a later turn with 8 damage lightning strike!

I'm liking Thor Justice now, but I'm still a fan of Justice.
Second Match of Round 1 Solo Champions League. Rhino Standard + Masters of Evil 7 Turns 5 health left 0 villain + minions 0 threat
Good win. I would have had Rhino in 6 if it wasn't for the tough status showing up to extend it one more round.
Match 3 round 1 of the Solo Champions League. Standard Rhino. My hand started out bad which slowed me down, but I got the win in 10 turns. 9HP left and 4 threat on schemes. No minions.

Play match 1 of round 1 solo league. Thor Justice is my pick against Rhino + masters of evil. I figured enough minions would be in the deck for Thor to do this thang. Worked well. Got the win. 11/19 health, one minion left (7), 0 threat, 6 turns.
Tough loss to standard Green Goblin Risky Business with Legions of Hydra. Got overwhelmed.

Got the win against standard Green Goblin Risky Business with Ms. Marvel. Did quite well even though main scheme got to level two. I probably only used only 3 protections cards the whole game: Tackle (for stun), Med Team for the heals, and two energy barriers to reflect damage.
Ultron Standard with Under Attack. Really long drawn out game. Under Surveillance came in handy as well as Concussive Blow. Whiplash showed up to the party as well.

Amazing win with Black Widow aggression. Standard Wrecking Crew. I was inspired by Frankie (aka BrokenAxe) to try this after his SGOYT post about his experience. She rocked the crew and kept them under control. She became a beast once she got Endurance and Down Time down. Counterattack was critical many times and got me the final blow on Wrecker.

Thor got payback against Green Goblin Risky Business. I had a turn where I had to win and I need to deal out 16 damage to the villain and 4 to a guard. Lightning strike, hammer throw, Hercules attack, and Thor attack... BOom.
Tough Loss. Standard Ultron. Things went well until Madame Hydra and Loki showed up in same round
Tough loss against standard Ultron. I almost got him to stage two, but I always felt like I was falling behind with him.
Rhino Heroic 1. Bad scheme out. Oof
Rhino Heroic 1. I did much better, but still got schemed out.

Rough and long game against Green Goblin Mutagen Formula. Jachin nearly got knocked out and I got down to 4HP. We were able to claw our way back to victory with a quite a walloping in the last round. Jachin drew a ton of cards to really do some work taking out the Goblin Thralls and getting GG down to 3 hp. Ms. Marvel tackled him for the finish.
Loss to Rhino standard, but a close one. Ms. Marvel has some very nice hero cards.
Another loss to Rhino standard with Ms. Marvel
Cap'n and Widow take down Green Goblin's mutagen formula!
Played Spiderman protection with some tweaks. Couldn't beat standard Green Goblin "Risky Business"
Captain America took that standard Green Goblin Risky Business down!
I got revenge on the Wrecking Crew with Thor. I did tweak Thor's deck a little bit but still stayed with aggression.

Green Goblin Standard Mutagen Formula against Captain America and Black Widow. Tough game that went about 13 turns, but we got him. That level II GG reveal was nasty getting 2 encounter cards dealt to each hero.
Crappy loss on Season 0 Game 3. Expert Rhino. I don't know what I was thinking. I guess I should have taken a mulligan.
Beat Expert Rhino/Under Attack, unfortunately I couldn't count it in tournament, but it felt good to get the win after such a horrible loss.

I tested out a play against Rhino Expert/Under Attack before playing the offiical solo league match with Black Widow. I've never played Expert before, and I know BW is going to have trouble with her lower HP count. I chose Captain America so I would feel cheating since the league game is a one-shot attempt. Let's just say Cap'n crushed it in 5 turns. Rhino came at him with double charge, but shield block stopped the 10 HP attack. BW would not have handled that well. The match would have been 4 turns but the stupid Vibranium armor slowed things down.
Standard Klaw, Bomb Scare, Game 2 of Season 0 League. 11 turns

Season 0 of league play Black widow with my first custom deck. I tweak a few cards.
Played Rhino Standard with Masters of Evil. It got touchy around turn 3 & 4 where health got down to 3, but I was able to storm bag with plenty of prep cards. Counter Surveillance came in handy giving me breathing room to heal up while the villain schemed. After that, I was able to cruise and manage things until I put the final blow with a prep card combo for the hit. I had both gauntlets down and plenty of prerparation cards in the tableau by turn 6. Espionage didn't come into play, but it might prove more useful against Klaw's Weapons Runners
Got the win but it wasn't fair. I was missing basic cards so didn't have a normal size deck. Standard Klaw
Legit win this time. Crushed Klaw majorly. I think I only got to turn 4 when I took him out. It was quite quick. I think I'm understanding She Hulk now
Tough loss. Almost had Klaw on the ropes.
Couldn't get the guantlets down in time to help with prep against Klaw
Another loss to klaw with BW

Played against Rhino with Black Widow. She's pretty cool. I kind of like her and is probably my favorite female superhero to play. I like the way her "Preparation" card combs work. She kind feels like Iron Man/BP, but her "armor" only sticks around until used.

Lost to the Green Goblin. Didn't help that Loki came out in the middle of it with his stupid family feud. Got beat up as Thor's hand dwindled to nothing and unable to do anything. GG was nasty by drawing up multiple attacks.

Spidey and Cap'n could not handle the Green Goblin mutagen formula. The cloud took over the city.
GG was nasty. I had one turn where we got overloaded with Goblins and if it weren't for a timely shield toss from Cap'n we would have been in a world of hurt.

Crushed the Wrecking Crew. I didn't even break a sweat! I could not beat them with Thor or Iron Man Justice, but got beat down by them.
Captain America just shellacked them. I took out PileDriver first round to avoid his Distracting Taunts. Shield Tosses put a hurt on everyone and a couple of Heroic Strikes to stun the active villain. Bulldozer was second to go, then Thunderball who got one stun in, then finally wrecker.
Tougher against Klaw. Didn't quite play correctly, but still tough.

Wow! Captain America rocks.
Crushed Ultron in one of my fastest games to date.

Thor against Ultron. Took him down but it was close. Thor did better with more minions in play so he could draw 2 extra each phase he was in hero form. It was a very satisfying end to the game where Ultron's countdown just started, Thor's obligation came out as Thor had 5 remaining hit points, Ultron was at 8 hit points... what do you do? I chose to exhaust (already in Odinson) to remove card. Flip to Thor and use Hammer throw for the finish!
Played stage I Rhino to teach Eve. We won. Not sure she liked it that much.
Fought Rhino and barely lost to a scheme out. It was close.

First time playing Thor and second time with the Wrecking Crew. It seemed fitting since the two go together based on the early comics. Thor fared better than Iron Man/Justice, but I just couldn't finish them. It dragged out a long time, but they schemed out. I was possibly too aggressive with the Defender of the Nine Realms card plays because it makes them cycle their deck faster which leads to acceleration tokens (more threat in the long run), but Thor doesn't have much besides that card to deal with threat.
Got butt stomped by Wrecking Crew. Only took out the wrecker. Iron Man/Justice

Played against standard Ultron the first time. I used Black Panther Leadership and put the smackdown on him on the final countdown. Hawkeye was critical at keeping the drones at bay. I'm not sure how to beat Ultron without him.

Taught Clay Marvel Champions. I think he liked it. We kept standard Rhino under control quite well with Iron Man/Justice and Black Panther/Leadership.
Logged in MC logger form.
Man handled Klaw with Black Panther leadership the right way
Got the win against Klaw with Iron Man/Justice. I'm really digging this combination.
Yielded this game right away. I saw that Iron Man/Aggression would scheme out asap before I could get anything in play. I'm not sure how to play this against Klaw either.

We beat expert Rhino with Bomb Scare. Tough game even with three players. It actually came down to a round where we really had to take him out or we schemed out. She-Hulk was down to 1 hit point and almost died.
Jachin and I really struggled with expert Klaw II & III with Masters of Evil. I think I should have got more Justice out ahead of time instead of my upgrades.

Still can't beat Klaw with She-Hulk/Justice. Most of the time it's a scheme problem. I get behind on those stupid minions like the armored guard keeping the guard in play to keep me from hitting klaw at the wrong time.

Good game against Klaw 1/2 with Masters of Evil. I played She Hulk/Justice and Jachin was Iron Man/Aggression. We handled the threat decently, and I finished him off. I thought She-Hulk was going to get knocked out and Jachin would have to take out the villain at 1HP. However, I forgot that I could go alter-ego to avoid getting knocked out with 4HP. That pushed his scheme to the next level, but Klaw was dealt with after that phase.
Klaw beat me down. She Hulk Justice
Again.. beat down, schemed out even though I handle hand better and got gamma slam down. Standard Klaw.

Fought Klaw again and Masters of Evil. I was playing She-Hulk with Justice Aspect, and I almost beat Klaw. I learned the value of Avengers Mansion which really helps She-Hulk in Hero Form. Focused Rage is useful too in combo with Avengers Mansion to get yet another extra card (for 2 more). The damage from Focused Rage can help setup for Gamma Slam which turned out to be my undoing. Even though I nailed Klaw for 14 damage, I couldn't quite survive the villain round when he drew Sound Manipulation to kill me. Good game!

Jachin and I took on Klaw with BP/Leadership and She-Hulk/Protection. Got beat, even though I felt like we were on the cusp. Jachin felt like he couldn't draw enough Wakanda Forevers to get going. I really struggled with She-Hulk's crummy hero hand size to be effective.

Beat the Klaw with Panther Leadership. However, I didn't really use Leadership hardly at all (maybe 2 cards, Maria Hill and the one phase buff). I really cranked the Wakanda Forever engine particularly at the end with Ancestral Knowledge to prime a previous 3 WF move back into the deck, then Golden City, then Golden City next turn, flip hero and WF three more times.
Taught Will and Grant. We barely beat standard Rhino. SpiderMan Justice, Black Panther/Leadership, Captain Marvel/Aggression
First time against standard Klaw. It was rough. Panther/Leader, Spider Man/Justice.

Jachin and I played standard Rhino again. It was Jachin's 2nd game. He played Captain Marvel aggression and I play Iron Man Justice. We smacked Rhino down. I eventually did 21 damage with 3 repulsor blasts, powered gauntlet, and two attacks, and Jachin finished him off with energy channel.

Played Standard Rhino with Bomb Scare. This time I paired up Iron Man with Justice and that worked way better than Aggression. I was able to handle the threat level better while I got the armor built. It was actually a long battle though, but very satisfying.
She Hulk + Leadership, didn't win against more expert Rhino. Got threated out.
Tried Iron Man and aggression..also got threated out. Standard Rhino

Played Standard Rhino again with Jachin this time. I played rules more correctly which actually made it easier because some cards were skipped now by doing the boost draws whereas before every card was coming into play.

Crushed Rhino (II & III) with Captain Marvel and never took damage. Energy Channel with Energy Absorption is so potent. I took Rhino III down in one turn with tac team (2 damage), Energy Channel (10 damage), and Hulk (3 damage + 2 damage on draw).
WOW! Great first game playing SpiderMan against standard villain Rhino. I won, but I didn't really from missing a couple of rules. Really fun game.
